Snaps on flashlight to protect group when encountering a monster, showing care and leadership.
Asks Kiersten to hand him a flashlight and pins the monster in the beam, taking initiative in a tense situation.
Admits he was supposed to be one of the monsters but insists he is not, showing honesty and vulnerability.
Steps toward Kiersten and pleads with her to help save Eric despite being suspected as 'one of them'.
Leads the group cautiously by peeking around a corner and making a plan to save Eric.
Snaps on his flashlight quickly to reveal a monster's camouflage, demonstrating prompt situational awareness.
Pins the monster transformed into clothes with a flashlight beam to immobilize it.
When revealed as partially transformed himself, he maintains composure and quickly refocuses the group on their mission to save Eric.
Plans to take side stairs and strategize approach to confront the Boss and rescue Eric, showing foresight and tactical thinking.
Avoids confrontation with Kiersten's suspicions and persuades her to cooperate rather than escalate conflict.
Pins monster with flashlight, compliments Kiersten 'Good shooting.'
Leads group to safety quickly and decisively.
Stops Todd from pointing flashlight directly at Maurice, preventing exposure.
Uses suspicious appraisal toward Maurice before acting.
Refuses to believe Maurice is a monster and calls him his friend despite others' mistrust.
Smiles, relieved and happy that his trust in Maurice was justified.
Trusts Maurice despite warnings from Todd, showing good judgment and confidence in his choice.
Calmly observes the situation and confirms his trust was correct when Maurice successfully leads monsters away.
Rubs his jaw while sharing a quiet moment with friends Todd and Kiersten; smiles exchanged with Kiersten suggest friendly, comfortable rapport.
Steps past Todd and Kiersten focusing on opening the Nightmare doors, showing leadership and calm focus.
Attempts to negotiate by stating his desire for his brother, showing focus rather than aggression.
Immediately brandishes the Sun-Gun and reacts defensively when threatened.
Steps forward cautiously, uses a light with thumb on the ON switch to illuminate the dark room, showing thoughtfulness and readiness.
Brandishes the Sun-Gun with determination and no hesitation when confronting the boy, demonstrating confidence and decisiveness.
Quickly bounces up after being shoved down and immediately snaps on the Sun-Gun again, showing resilience and alertness under pressure.
Fails to prevent Snik from destroying the Sun-Gun's cord, resulting in loss of his main weapon.
Does not notice Kiersten is out of flashlights until after losing the Sun-Gun's power, indicating a gap in resource management or situational awareness.
Shows disbelief and mistrust toward Maurice, who pretended to be his friend to lure him down.
Focuses on finding and saving his brother Eric, indicating care and concern.
Uses the penlight to protect Eric by targeting Snik, helping Eric escape.
Leads friends through dangerous monster-filled area, encouraging them with optimism.
Uses the penlight strategically to disarm and transform Snik's body parts, freeing Eric and gaining control of the situation.
Leads his friends confidently toward the monsters and uses the environment to evade them by navigating side routes and leaping across gaps.
Accidentally runs full-tilt into a bed shadow, hitting his head and showing a momentary lapse in awareness.
Turns back to the shadow and pushes then slams his fists in frustration and anger.
Rushes at the boy with a roar despite risk, lashes out defensively when attacked by Snik.
Lashes out violently at Snik, kicking him viciously.
Sits up groaning after being struck and does not respond to Kiersten shining a penlight on his arm.
Scrambles to his feet and attempts to fight back against Snik, showing determination and resilience.
Fails to land his kick; is immediately countered and knocked to the floor.
After being stunned and losing the fight, he groans and sits up when his pack is removed, indicating physical toughness and persistence.
Does not react when Kiersten shines a penlight on his arm, possibly indicating stoicism or unconsciousness.
Accuses the Boss of trickery, showing directness and a sense of justice.
Is dropped unceremoniously by Snik and silently stares after Maurice, drops his head, showing vulnerability and concern.
Snaps his gaze to the Boss immediately after a monster wrestles the light from Kiersten.
Acknowledges being tricked by the Boss with a direct statement: 'You tricked me.'
Does not resist or retaliate when dropped unceremoniously by Snik and then watches Maurice flee, dropping his head.
Quickly uses the Sun-Gun to help defeat the Boss and protect others.
Looks around wildly and calls out for Maurice after the fight, showing concern.

Commands rolling to his backpack, skillfully grabbing it from Spike, and dives for the Sun-Gun on the floor; strips a wire with his teeth; twists down the wing nuts on the battery; brings up the lamp and activates it, using brilliant white light to defeat the Boss monster effectively.
Drops the lamp and looks around wildly, calling out for Maurice, indicating momentary disorientation or lack of control after using the weapon.
Encourages friends by saying 'monsters don't help friends--'
Gives Maurice a long look before climbing through the hole, showing hesitation but not abandoning him
Warns Maurice that other monsters will kill him
Hands Maurice the penlight, sharing resources and trust
Surveys the room before acting, showing situational awareness.
Gives Maurice a long look before climbing through the hole, indicating thoughtful decision-making rather than impulsiveness.
Takes the penlight from Kiersten and assesses it, then hands it to Maurice with a raised eyebrow, demonstrating prudent assessment and communication.
Does not immediately leave when urged, showing some hesitation or indecision.
Thanks Kiersten for the help, showing appreciation and acknowledging support.
Smiles warmly at Eric, and shares a smile back with him, indicating friendly and sincere interaction.
Allows Glen to pull him into a hug, shows receptiveness to affection and connection.
Attempts to reach through the shadow to Maurice, expressing yearning and emotional connection.
Pulls out his watch and notes the exact moment the second hand ticks to twelve as the sun clears the horizon, demonstrating attentiveness and situational awareness.
Attempts to reach through the shadow to Maurice but acknowledges that it is only a shadow, showing acceptance of limits and reality.
Thanks Kiersten for help and accepts support gracefully, indicating interpersonal awareness and humility.
Stands a little to the side during the group reunion but shares a smile and receives a hug, suggesting measured social confidence and emotional intelligence.
